result.execSummary:
The defendant Kasey L. Rupp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Capture an Intimate Representation, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT WITH ANY OTHER SENTENCE CURRENTLY BEING SERVED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Departments assessment process.

Have no contact with R.H. DOB: 06-22-1981.

Provide DNA sample.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC.
Maintain fulltime employment/school if able - this condition is at the agent's discretion.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kasey L. Rupp

records.addlTxt: Dominque McQueen through Public Defender

Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody in Manitowoc County Jail.
Attorney not appointed through public defender yet.  Options of court appointed attorney and Public defender appointment is explained to the defendant. He wished to wait for public defender to appoint.  Preliminary hearing is reset to 03-15-22 at 10:00 a.m.  (PD notified of new date)

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 03-04-22 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Victim, on 10-19-21.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 3rd degree sexual assault.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-28-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with R.L.H. and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
